meanings.definition: The middle part or section of something.
meanings.sent1: The middlings of the cake were the most delicious part.
meanings.sent2: She found the treasure hidden in the middlings of the forest.
meanings.sent3: The middlings of the movie were the scenes with the funny sidekick.
meanings.sent4: In the middlings of the storm, a rainbow appeared in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The middlings of the sandwich, the juicy tomatoes, made it extra tasty.

meanings.definition: A mixture of wheat bran and shorts used as animal feed.
meanings.sent1: The farmer fed the chickens with a scoop of middlings.
meanings.sent2: The horses eagerly ate the nutritious middlings in their trough.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat managed to spill the bag of middlings all over the barn.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of fresh middlings attracted all the farm animals.
meanings.sent5: The barn cats enjoyed hunting mice near the pile of middlings.

meanings.definition: Something intermediate or average in quality.
meanings.sent1: The painting was nice, but it fell into the middlings of the art show.
meanings.sent2: The hotel offered middlings service, neither exceptional nor terrible.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were in the middlings, not too funny but not boring either.
meanings.sent4: Her singing voice was in the middlings, not outstanding but pleasant to listen to.
meanings.sent5: The weather was in the middlings, not too hot or too cold, just right for a picnic.
